verses.verse: Is there not <S%H3808><s%> an appointed time <S%H6635><s%> to man <S%H582><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> earth? <S%H776><s%> are not his days <S%H3117><s%> also like the days <S%H3117><s%> of a hireling? <S%H7916><s%>
As a servant <S%H5650><s%> earnestly desireth <S%H7602><s%> the shadow, <S%H6738><s%> and as a hireling <S%H7916><s%> looketh for <S%H6960><s%> the reward of his work: <S%H6467><s%>
So <S%H3651><s%> am I made to possess <S%H5157><s%> months <S%H3391><s%> of vanity, <S%H7723><s%> and wearisome <S%H5999><s%> nights <S%H3915><s%> are appointed <S%H4487><s%> to me.

When <S%H518><s%> I lie down, <S%H7901><s%> I say, <S%H559><s%> When <S%H4970><s%> shall I arise, <S%H6965><s%> and the night <S%H6153><s%> be gone? <S%H4059><s%> and I am full <S%H7646><s%> of tossings to and fro <S%H5076><s%> unto <S%H5704><s%> the dawning of the day. <S%H5399><s%>

My flesh <S%H1320><s%> is clothed <S%H3847><s%> with worms <S%H7415><s%> and clods <S%H1487><s%> of dust; <S%H6083><s%> my skin <S%H5785><s%> is broken, <S%H7280><s%> and become loathsome. <S%H3988><s%>
My days <S%H3117><s%> are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> a weaver's shuttle, <S%H708><s%> and are spent <S%H3615><s%> without <S%H657><s%> hope. <S%H8615><s%>
O remember <S%H2142><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> my life <S%H2416><s%> is wind: <S%H7307><s%> mine eye <S%H5869><s%> shall no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H7725><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> good. <S%H2896><s%>
The eye <S%H5869><s%> of him that hath seen <S%H7210><s%> me shall see <S%H7789><s%> me no <S%H3808><s%> more: thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> are upon me, and I am not. <S%H369><s%>

As the cloud <S%H6051><s%> is consumed <S%H3615><s%> and vanisheth away: <S%H1980><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> he that goeth down <S%H3381><s%> to the grave <S%H7585><s%> shall come up <S%H5927><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more.
He shall return <S%H7725><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> to his house, <S%H1004><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall his place <S%H4725><s%> know <S%H5234><s%> him any more. <S%H5750><s%>

Therefore <S%H1571><s%> I <S%H589><s%> will not <S%H3808><s%> refrain <S%H2820><s%> my mouth; <S%H6310><s%> I will speak <S%H1696><s%> in the anguish <S%H6862><s%> of my spirit; <S%H7307><s%> I will complain <S%H7878><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul. <S%H5315><s%>
Am I <S%H589><s%> a sea, <S%H3220><s%> or <S%H518><s%> a whale, <S%H8577><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> thou settest <S%H7760><s%> a watch <S%H4929><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> me?
When <S%H3588><s%> I say, <S%H559><s%> My bed <S%H6210><s%> shall comfort <S%H5162><s%> me, my couch <S%H4904><s%> shall ease <S%H5375><s%> my complaint; <S%H7879><s%>
Then thou scarest <S%H2865><s%> me with dreams, <S%H2472><s%> and terrifiest <S%H1204><s%> me through visions: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2384><s%>
So that my soul <S%H5315><s%> chooseth <S%H977><s%> strangling, <S%H4267><s%> and death <S%H4194><s%> rather than my life. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6106><s%>

I loathe <S%H3988><s%> it; I would not <S%H3808><s%> live <S%H2421><s%> always: <S%H5769><s%> let me alone; <S%H2308><s%> <S%H4480><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> my days <S%H3117><s%> are vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

What <S%H4100><s%> is man, <S%H582><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> thou shouldest magnify <S%H1431><s%> him? and that <S%H3588><s%> thou shouldest set <S%H7896><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> upon <S%H413><s%> him?
And that thou shouldest visit <S%H6485><s%> him every morning, <S%H1242><s%> and try <S%H974><s%> him every moment? <S%H7281><s%>

How long <S%H4100><s%> wilt thou not <S%H3808><s%> depart <S%H8159><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> me, nor <S%H3808><s%> let me alone <S%H7503><s%> till <S%H5704><s%> I swallow down <S%H1104><s%> my spittle? <S%H7536><s%>

I have sinned; <S%H2398><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> shall I do <S%H6466><s%> unto thee, O thou preserver <S%H5341><s%> of men? <S%H120><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> hast thou set <S%H7760><s%> me as a mark <S%H4645><s%> against thee, so that I am <S%H1861><s%> a burden <S%H4853><s%> to <S%H5921><s%> myself?

And why <S%H4100><s%> dost thou not <S%H3808><s%> pardon <S%H5375><s%> my transgression, <S%H6588><s%> and take away <S%H5674><s%> <S%H853><s%> mine iniquity? <S%H5771><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> shall I sleep <S%H7901><s%> in the dust; <S%H6083><s%> and thou shalt seek me in the morning, <S%H7836><s%> but I shall not <S%H369><s%> be.
